data.title: Amazing Historic Hotel!
data.text: The River Inn is located right on the river, within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants. Our room had a balcony so that we could see everything. The parking garage was only a few blocks away and was very easy to get to. Make sure to do a little  exploring in the hotel itself. It was a little confusing to get to but they have a rooftop terrace where you can watch the ships come in!

data.title: City visit
data.text: This hotel has a great location by the river and easy walking to visit the city. We loved Savannah and enjoyed walking and the trolley ride. The hotel is an old building and the room had a river view and was nicely furnished, It was dark, however this was a feature of the age of the building and was to be expected. We found the staff generally pleasant and helpful. We had booked a package including breakfast and the trolley bus ride around the city. On checking in we did remind the staff member and asked about breakfast and where to get the trolley bus. She did not tell us that we needed vouchers for the breakfast and the first morning we went for breakfast and as we did not have a voucher the server asked me to go to reception to get them. The server handled this empathetically. At reception the staff member gave me the vouchers without any sort of apology. I also thought I had better check if I needed a voucher for the trolley service, which I did. Again this was the organised without any apology. I would recommend that staff are better trained to explain  to guests how the breakfast and trolley ride add ons work. Overall though a very pleasant hotel in a great location

data.title: Lovely place to stay!
data.text: We had a river view room and it was amazing at night to see the lights and by day you could see all the ships coming and going from the international port.  The room was very clean and we could not have asked for a more hospitable place to stay.  Great tub and lots of hot water...wonderful for soaking those little tootsies after tons of walking to sightsee in Savannah!  Loved it.

data.title: Great Stay
data.text: River Inn was recommended by American Express. The room was great right on the water. We were able to look out the window and watch the ships going up and down the river. The room was clean. The bathtub was great lots of hot water for both of us to take long soaking baths.

data.title: What a Dump!
data.text:
I selected the Savannah River Inn because of it's location- which is great.  However, when I checked into my room the first thing I noticed was big chunks of porcelain  missing from the bathtub- rusty iron showing.  The next thing I noticed was the paint peeling from the walls.  later I noticed that I couldn't get hot - or even warm - water out of the sink.  But what really got me was the sheet of paper they hand you at check-in warning you of the noise at the place and commenting that illegal activity will not be tolerated.  On the sheet - they offered to move you to another hotel if this was a problem.  I've traveled for over 40 years and this was a first.

I decided to stick it out.  However, on both nights I stayed I was awakend at 3 - 4 AM by very loud voices of people returning to their rooms from the bars - which are nearby.  This motel is constructed so that you can hear just about every door being slammed at the motel - no matter where it is.  I was on the third floor and requested a quiet room.  Believe me- there is no quiet at the Savannah River Inn.  It's one of few places I've stayed where I didn't feel safe.  Maybe it was because it was a weekend - but based on the condition of the room and the warning to guests by management- I think this place has problems and I would never stay there again.

data.title: Clean place to sleep and shower, free parking, great location and price!
data.text: I stayed here with my teenage daughter while visiting Georgia Southern University. This hotel was located right behind River street and was in walking distance to everything.  The room was clean, vacuumed, no moldy shower curtains, great water pressure. The staff was nice, especially Neil, who helped me out with a parking issue.  The parking is free and they are constantly towing cars that dont belong in the lot to assure visitors that they always have a parking spot. I have only nice things to say about the hotel and staff, however, if someone stops to visit you, their car could be towed within minutes and the impound lot is in the worst section of town.  This motel is worth the price paid  for the location. As far as safety, you have yo use common sense. Dont walk alone and be aware of your surroundings. The motel itself was very safe in my opinion.

data.title: Never again!
data.text:
We booked a room here thinking we were getting such a deal. We actually canceled a reservation at another hotel. Big mistake! The photo they have on their site and all the travel sites...not theirs! It is for the Best Western which they used to be affiliated with and no longer are. However, the two locations (located across the street from each other) share staff. And it is clear that the staff's priority is the Best Western. We were there for 7 nights. 4 of the 7 we actually had to request housekeeping tend to our room. There was a hole in the wall behind the door and one of the locks on the door did not work and we had to request it be fixed. The tub in the bathroom had chipped paint and the shower could not be turned on full force or the shower curtain would attack you - so with the shower running on low it meant the faucet was running as well and it filled the tub with water. There is no free wifi as that is also part of the Best Western and not the Savannah River Inn. Total false advertising. 

The only thing this place had to offer was a convenient location at a cheaper price. But the price was not worth it! Once we were there we had no real choice to move locations as we had budgeted our trip based on the price.

data.title: Better than expected
data.text: We stayed here after dropping my stepkids off with their mother. We met halfway between VA and FL and decided to spend a night in Savannah and go to Paula Deen's restaurant. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and it was ideal for the money we paid. It's within walking distance of River Street and the great shops & restaurants.

data.title: Dirty
data.text: We went to Savannah to attend a wedding. The bride and groom suggested this place because of it's convenience to the reception location. There were actually at least three other hotels that were also convenient to the repection location and they were cleaner. There was blood on the bathroom walls and there were ants all over the room. The carpet had not been cleaned since 1981. At 1:00am you could still hear the traffic and music blarring from a block away. Not to mention it was in a dark location that did not seem safe. There was nothing relaxing or comforting about this room. You get what you pay for. Next time before I listen to someone suggesting a hotel, I will do more research.

data.title: Better than expected
data.text: I read a lot of reviews and was a little weary about the hotel. However, once I got there I was pleasantly suprised. The hotel itself is older and the rooms are small, but we were just looking for a place to lay our head at night. The bathrooms were clean, the staff was friendly and the location was out of this world. If you're looking for a high-class hotel, this is not it. But if you're looking to save money and still get a hotel right next to River Street and a clean bed, this is definitely the spot. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

data.title: Big rooms, value for money
data.text: My wife and I stayed here in May for a week. We booked on Hotwire and were pleasantly suprised with the hotel. Our room was spacious and included a king size bed, plasma tv, bar fridge, separate shower/bath/toilet and air conditioner. There was also a separate coffee table set up with two chairs. No continental breakfast was included although a coffee machine was at reception. There was also a coin operated soft drink machine near available within the hotel complex. There was a pool available for use but it was too cold to use when we were there. There are better located hotels than this but the historic quarter is only small in any case and basically on the doorstep of the hotel, this hotel is near the river which was good. No internet access however I used the internet at the public library which is a 5 minute walk away. The only supermarket nearby is a 20 or so minute walk away but there are plenty of restaurants, fast food options nearby. I would definitely stay here again for the price.

data.title: great value
data.text: My sister and I stayed here, she has a small dog, and it's had to find a decent place to stay that accepts pets.  No extra charge for pets ( under 20 pounds ). Parking was free, rooms were clean, price was good considering how close it was to everything .  There is no view but we were1 block from the river front. We would stay here again!!!.

data.title: Convenient little jewel...
data.text:
OK.  So it's not the Hilton, but we had no problems with cleanliness or anything like that.  Very nice for the price.  Staff was exceptionally friendly.  The pool did have some water bugs in it, but it was Savannah in May, so bugs are to be expected.

I heard they were tearing down this little hotel, but if they hadn't I would definitely have recommended it to budget-conscious friends.  It was less than two blocks from both River Street and City Market.  You can't beat that.

data.title: TERRIBLE!!! Don't even think about giving it a chance...
data.text: I am writing this review from room 517 counting the hours to leave this rat hole. I stayed here for 2 nights, and hated this place. The first room they gave me was dirty, the bathroom disgusting and the coffee machine and fridge weren't working. The receptionist, a nice guy that has to deal with this lack of maintenance, management and housekeeping, gave us another room (this one, 517). It looked better but it smelled like old bleu cheese! The heater wasn't working (It's freezing outside now), the fridge makes a weird noise all the time and the smoke alarm was beeping every 30 seconds (I just disconnected it and gave it to the receptionist). Also, when we came back to the room today at 5PM, the beds were not made (we left at 10 AM, giving housekeepers 7 hours to do their job). My advise is, read not only my review but all the other reviews about this place and you will understand why you shouldn't think about this place even if it's $10 cheaper than any other motel.

data.title: Good price, gross bathrooms
data.text: You may be thinking, "you can't beat the price!"  I just want to remind you that the Savannah River Inn is a motel...it'll do if you're just looking for a room.  The bathroom in our first room was absolutely disgusting--thick black rings around the toilet bowl, large splotches of black mold on the shower curtain, and rust rings in the bathtub. To be fair, they switched us into the room next door upon request--and it was definitely better (though still had the moldy curtains).

data.title: You Get What You Pay For!
data.text: I wanted to save a couple of bucks...and I did! Savannah River Inn is in the right spot at the right price....I am a frequent traveler to this area, and I did not think that a hotel such as this still existed in this part of town. I was able to get free parking, microwave & fridge. A king size bed with a sitting area for a fraction of the cost. Sure, it's not shiny or new, but if you are looking to splurge on gifts...you've already saved by staying at this hotel. I also checked their Saint Patricks' rates and they are the lowest to be found in this area at $189 per night. I booked a room, because I heard it is awesome time!

data.title: Disgusting motel... good location
data.text: Tried to save a few bucks by staying at a 2 star hotel reserved on hotwire.   I'm not very picky, but there is no way this a 2 star.  This motel was far worse than your average Motel 6.   For example, my lamp in the room had no lampshade.  Savannah was nice, though and this place is located close to the action near River St and Bay St.

data.title: AWESOME VALUE!
data.text:
We stayed at the hotel for three nights this past weekend. We booked the hotel thru Hotwire.com for under $50/night. We did not know what hotel we would be staying at until after we paid.

Our experience was it was a great value considering what you would pay to stay at other hotels by the river. The hotel had cable TV, a microwave, and fridge (no freezer). Staff was super! The place was very, very quiet. A couple of mornings, I counted the cars in the parking lot early in the morning - 8 to 10 cars was all.

The best I can come up with for complaints was the pool needed skimming. After three days the hotel ice maker was still broken. The shower had some mold. The carpet had some specs of dirt.

I would stay there again.

data.title: Hated it.
data.text: I absolutely agree with all of nashvilleshortstuff's review. I chose this hotel through hotels.com because of the price. I have always had good luck before using travel sites and picking inexpensive prices. All I need is a clean and safe place to stay. I spend the money on touring and restaurants. Savannah River Inn needs to be torn down and not offered to any travelers. The bathroom was obviously not cleaned before we got there or while we were there, the shower curtain was falling down, the ice machine didn't work. The office is a travesty. This hotel is clearly not interested in providing any kind of hospitality or semblance of ambience to its guests. It was the worst hotel experience in my life. Savannah should not embarrass itself by offering this hotel to people. It is such a wonderful city with so much to offer and so many hotels to be proud of. This hotel is one big blight in the area. It needs to be gone.

data.title: Better then expected
data.text:
I must say I booked this hotel because of the price and location for a Sat. night stay in Savannah.  Saturday's night stays are very expensive in the city.  

I was very pleased with this hotel - which is more like a motor inn.  The rooms are standard - nothing fancy but who stays in their room anyway.  I had a King Size Bed -and a large screeen tv.  They had a coffee maker - refig and micorwave which I thought were nice touches.

The room is like staying in downtown Las Vegas so if you have stayed there you know what to expect. 

I parked in the lot and was able to cover all the city by ground at this hotel.  The hotel has a view of the power plant so don't expect a river view.  They was no charge for parking which is pretty rare in Savannah.  I stayed at the Ennis (sp) Days Inn on my last trip and this hotel was ten times better plus they didn't charge for parking.
